description: Assesses personality traits to guide academic and career choices for students in 10th, 11th/12th, and UG levels.

questions.question_text: How would you describe your approach to meeting new people?

options.text: I enjoy meeting new people and feel energized by social interactions.
I am comfortable but prefer small groups or one-on-one interactions.
I find it draining and prefer to keep to myself.
It depends on the situation and my mood.

questions.explanation: High extroversion may suit collaborative fields like BBA or Mass Communication; introversion aligns with independent paths like BCA or B.Tech.

questions.question_text: How do you feel about trying new activities or subjects?

options.text: I love exploring new ideas and challenges.
I am open but prefer some familiarity.
I stick to what I know well.
I need time to warm up to new things.

questions.explanation: High openness suits creative fields like BFA or Mass Communication; low openness aligns with structured paths like B.Com or CA.

questions.question_text: How do you approach completing assignments or tasks?

options.text: I plan carefully and complete tasks on time.
I work steadily but sometimes procrastinate.
I often rush to finish at the last minute.
I prioritize based on urgency and importance.

questions.explanation: High conscientiousness is critical for disciplined fields like MBBS or CA; lower scores may suit flexible paths like B.A.

questions.question_text: How do you react when a classmate disagrees with you?

options.text: I listen and try to understand their perspective.
I defend my point but remain respectful.
I find it hard to stay calm during disagreements.
I avoid arguments and keep my opinions to myself.

questions.explanation: High agreeableness suits teamwork-oriented fields like BBA or B.Ed; lower scores align with independent roles like B.Sc.

questions.question_text: How do you handle stress during exams or deadlines?

options.text: I stay calm and manage stress effectively.
I feel stressed but cope with some effort.
I often feel overwhelmed and struggle to cope.
I use specific techniques like deep breathing.

questions.explanation: High emotional stability is key for high-pressure fields like MBBS or CA; lower scores may suit less stressful paths like B.A.

questions.question_text: How often do you seek out group activities or team projects?

options.text: Very often, I thrive in group settings.
Occasionally, I enjoy a mix of group and solo work.
Rarely, I prefer working alone.
It depends on the task.

questions.explanation: Extroversion supports collaborative careers like Mass Communication; introversion suits solitary fields like BCA.

questions.question_text: How curious are you about learning new concepts?

options.text: Very curious, I love diving into new topics.
Somewhat curious, if it’s relevant to my goals.
Not very curious, I stick to familiar subjects.
My curiosity depends on the context.

questions.explanation: High openness is ideal for innovative fields like B.Tech or BFA; low openness suits structured paths like B.Com.

questions.question_text: How do you ensure your work is thorough and accurate?

options.text: I double-check everything meticulously.
I check my work but may miss small details.
I focus on finishing rather than perfecting.
I balance accuracy with efficiency.

questions.explanation: High conscientiousness is essential for precision-driven fields like CA or MBBS.

questions.question_text: How do you respond to a group member not contributing?

options.text: I encourage them to participate and offer help.
I address it politely but firmly.
I ignore it and focus on my work.
I take over their tasks to ensure completion.

questions.explanation: High agreeableness benefits team-oriented fields like BBA or B.Ed.

questions.question_text: How do you react to unexpected changes in plans?

options.text: I adapt quickly and stay calm.
I adjust but feel some discomfort.
I find it stressful and struggle to adapt.
I take time to plan my response.

questions.explanation: Emotional stability supports high-pressure fields like MBBS or M.Tech.

questions.question_text: How comfortable are you speaking in front of a group?

options.text: Very comfortable, I enjoy presenting.
Somewhat comfortable, with preparation.
Not comfortable, I avoid it.
It depends on the audience.

questions.explanation: Extroversion aids fields requiring public interaction, like Mass Communication or BBA.

questions.question_text: How often do you explore creative solutions to problems?

options.text: Always, I love thinking outside the box.
Sometimes, if the situation calls for it.
Rarely, I prefer proven methods.
Occasionally, when inspired.

questions.explanation: High openness suits innovative fields like BFA or B.Tech.

questions.question_text: How do you manage your study schedule?

options.text: I follow a strict schedule religiously.
I have a plan but adjust as needed.
I study when I feel motivated.
I prioritize urgent tasks first.

questions.explanation: High conscientiousness is key for structured fields like CA or MBBS.

questions.question_text: How do you handle conflicts with peers?

options.text: I seek compromise and mutual understanding.
I stand my ground but stay respectful.
I get frustrated and may argue.
I avoid conflicts entirely.

questions.explanation: Agreeableness supports collaborative fields like B.Ed or BBA.

questions.question_text: How do you feel after a challenging day?

options.text: I bounce back quickly and stay positive.
I feel tired but recover with rest.
I feel drained and need time to recover.
I reflect and plan to avoid future stress.

questions.explanation: Emotional stability is crucial for high-pressure careers like MBBS or M.Tech.

questions.question_text: How often do you initiate conversations with strangers?

options.text: Frequently, I enjoy connecting with others.
Occasionally, if the situation feels right.
Rarely, I wait for others to approach.
It depends on my mood.

questions.explanation: Extroversion suits outgoing fields like Mass Communication; introversion aligns with solitary roles like BCS.

questions.question_text: How interested are you in abstract or theoretical ideas?

options.text: Very interested, I enjoy deep thinking.
Somewhat interested, if it’s practical.
Not interested, I prefer concrete tasks.
It varies by topic.

questions.explanation: High openness suits theoretical fields like B.Sc or M.Sc; low openness aligns with practical fields like B.Com.

questions.question_text: How do you approach long-term projects?

options.text: I break them into manageable tasks and stay organized.
I work steadily but may lose focus.
I tackle them as deadlines approach.
I set milestones and adjust as needed.

questions.explanation: High conscientiousness is vital for rigorous fields like MBBS or CA Foundation.

questions.question_text: How do you respond to a friend asking for help?

options.text: I’m always ready to help without hesitation.
I help if I have time and resources.
I prefer to focus on my own tasks.
I help but set clear boundaries.

questions.explanation: High agreeableness suits supportive roles like B.Ed or MSW.

questions.question_text: How do you handle criticism from a teacher?

options.text: I take it constructively and improve.
I consider it but don’t always agree.
I feel upset and find it hard to accept.
I analyze it before responding.

questions.explanation: Emotional stability aids in handling feedback in high-stakes fields like MBBS or CA.

questions.question_text: How do you feel about leading a group project?

options.text: I enjoy taking charge and leading.
I’m okay leading if needed.
I prefer following someone else’s lead.
It depends on the team.

questions.explanation: Leadership inclination suits management fields like BBA or MBA.

questions.question_text: How often do you imagine new ways to approach tasks?

options.text: Frequently, I enjoy creative approaches.
Sometimes, when standard methods fail.
Rarely, I stick to what works.
Occasionally, when inspired.

questions.explanation: Creative thinking aligns with fields like BFA or Mass Communication.

questions.question_text: How do you prepare for exams or assessments?

options.text: I start early and follow a detailed plan.
I study regularly but adapt as needed.
I cram closer to the exam date.
I focus on key topics first.

questions.explanation: High conscientiousness is critical for fields requiring discipline, like MBBS or CA.

questions.question_text: How do you approach helping a struggling classmate?

options.text: I offer help willingly and patiently.
I help if asked and have time.
I focus on my own work instead.
I help but expect them to try harder.

questions.explanation: High agreeableness suits supportive roles like B.Ed or MSW.

questions.question_text: How do you cope with failure or setbacks?

options.text: I learn from it and move forward quickly.
I reflect and try to improve.
I feel discouraged and take time to recover.
I seek advice to overcome it.

questions.explanation: Emotional stability is key for resilient fields like MBBS or M.Tech.
